title: The INTERGALACTIC CIVIL WAR
body_text:
"For two thousand, one hundred, sixty nine agonizing days,
the
East Coast Dodgeball
empire has been in a state of civil war."
STAR WARS
was the 184th
East Coast Dodgeball
event produced within the "Tronolone Era." It took place on August 13, 2011, emanating from the Wall High School tennis courts located in Wall, New Jersey. It was recorded as the 36th
Wet War
.
STAR WARS featured one main attraction that involved members of the 2011
East Coast Dodgeball
roster from existing rivalries partly initiated by embellished storylines. Dodgeball players portrayed as themselves in an intensified manner as they followed a series of outings that built tension and culminated in a duel, commonly known as a "captains match."
Twenty (20) people participated, an attendance comprised of 12 men and 8 women.
PRODUCTION
The Wall High School tennis courts have played host to
ECD
events since late-2005, a legacy that continued for the STAR WARS presentation. The event itself gained media attention through Facebook as well as
ECD's
website and exclusive
TextMessagingService
.
No official theme song was selected for the event, although the introduction anthem to the
STAR WARS
movies composed by John Williams was played during the opening rush. Diana DiBuccio compiled the musical playlist for the event.
STARRING
Adams, Christopher
: Premiere legend, de facto chancellor during the 2009
ECD
era.
Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 3; Inducted into
ECDElite
Hall of Fame September 11, 2010.
Edwards, Michael
: Iconic crazy man, sole survivor of the dreaded 2006 summer.
Debuted at DODGEBALL 47; Inducted into
ECDElite
Hall of Fame November 27, 2010.
Fitzpatrick, Kevin
: Feared powerhouse, The Writer's top combatant of the modern age.
Debuted at DODGEBALL XTWO; Inducted into
ECDElite
Hall of Fame September 11, 2010.
Pierce, Justin
: Respected court general, multi-time award recipient.
Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 2; Inducted into
ECDElite
Hall of Fame September 11, 2010.
Winston, Lauren
: Famed framer of
East Coast Dodgeball
.
Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 1; Inducted into
ECDElite Family
wing of the Hall of Fame, November 27, 2010.
Winston, Valerie
: Famed framer of
East Coast Dodgeball
.
Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 1; Inducted into
ECDElite Family
wing of the Hall of Fame, November 27, 2010.
SUPPORTING CAST
Adams, Kevin^
: 2010
ECDElite
inductee.
Adams, Steve*
: 2x season finale headliner.
Buckley, Grace^
: Rookie sensation of 2011.
DiBuccio, Diana^
: 2010
ECDElite
inductee.
Hoppe, Ashley*
:
CREAMation X
headliner.
Katz, Zach*
: Future ANNIVERSARY 6 headliner.
Knott, Rob*
: 2011
ECD
photographer.
Lima, Joanice^
: Rookie sensation of 2011.
Oberto, Kelly^
: Rookie sensation of 2011.
Stopa, Lauren*
: 2011
ECDElite
inductee.
Teitelbaum, Jason*
: FAMILY AFFAIR II headliner.
Tronolone, John^
: 2011
ECDElite
inductee.
Wolf, Justin^
: Future ANNIVERSARY 6 headliner.
Writer, The
: Behind-the-scenes mastermind of
ECD
.
Yochum, Jon*
: FAMILY AFFAIR II headliner.
* = designates member of Team Adams, L. Winston, Edwards
^ = designates member of Team Pierce, V. Winston, Fitzpatrick
Bertsch, Alison
: Spectator.
Grand, Katie
: Spectator.
Moss, Samuel
: Spectator.
Winston, Roethlisberger
: Spectator (dog).
BACKGROUND
(See the
STAR WARS Preview
)
MAIN EVENT
Justin Pierce, Valerie Winston, Kevin Fitzpatrick
fought
Chris Adams, Lauren Winston, Michael Edwards
to a 5 - 5 draw.
► Stipulation: Games 3, 6, and 8 were competed under the "Captains Kill" / "Kill the Captain" rule. If the chosen captain was eliminated in any fashion, his or her entire team lost that round regardless of the number of in-play participants. The Writer paired the opposing captains prior to the match: Fitzpatrick-Edwards, Pierce-Adams, Winston-Winston.
Game 3 witnessed Michael Edwards single-handedly eliminate rival Kevin Fitzpatrick from competition. Edwards was on the verge of a multi-player attack before wisely rifling a weapon of his own to capture the monumental game victory.
In Game 6, Chris Adams was the sole survivor for his team before carefully regenerating a fraction of his squad to his aid. The extra time allowed him to carefully connect with a bulletball shot to rival Justin Pierce's foot, who had remained in a defense state throughout the round.
The Winston sisters were heavily guarded during the 8th game as massive amounts of amo were unleashed upon the set of siblings. The round came to a close when Valerie Winston unintentionally dodged into a Michael Edwards-thrown bulletball. With this victory, the Adams-L. Winston-Edwards coalition captured all three of these special contests.
It should be noted that the stipulation was originally set for every third game, but due to time restraints, round 9 was moved up one.
► Game-By-Game: Pierce-V. Winston-Fitzpatrick took home rounds 1, 5, 7, 9, and 10; Adams-L. Winston-Edwards won games 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8. The deciding 11th game was in progress when the tennis lights powered off. Thus, the score remained at a deadlocked 5 apiece.
INJURIES
A total of 8 headshots were reported during STAR WARS. In the opening contest, Justin Wolf was met with a speeding bulletball from Chris Adams directly to the left eye. Ashley Hoppe received three stinging shots herself, one of which shed a trivial amount of blood to her nose. Steve Adams, Jason Teitelbaum, and captains Edwards and Pierce were also perpetrated in similar fashion.
In an update from the previous month's SUMMER JAMBOREE, John Tronolone announced that his glenoid labrum, a fibrocartilaginous rim attached around the shoulder blade, is partially torn. An MRI and visit to an orthopedic surgeon confirmed such in late-July. Under doctors' orders, he was recommended to cease full-force throwing with his right arm.
AFTERMATH
Because of the shocking, inconclusive decision, The Writer has already announced that a rematch, particularly between the Winston sisters, will take place "in the near future." As of August 16, 2011, no word has been given on if and when the male co-captains will meet again.
The heated Katz-Wolf confrontation continued throughout STAR WARS and will culminate in a captains duel at ANNIVERSARY 6 on September 10, 2011.
STATISTICS
The special stipulation was the first to be officially used at an
ECD
event. Previous outings had included such, but were never instituted upon the actual captains.
As of August 16, 2011, captaincy statistics are as follows:
► Chris Adams is 7-7-1. This was his second three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL CXV in December 2007.
► Michael Edwards is 5-2-2. Along with Fitzpatrick, this was his record-sharing third three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL 100 and DIVORCE COURT.
► Kevin Fitzpatrick is 7-3-1. Along with Edwards, this was his record-sharing third three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL 100 and DODGEBALL CXV.
► Justin Pierce is 3-1-1. This was his second three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL 100 in August 2007, and his first match in the captains chair since that very same event.
► Lauren Winston is 4-5-3. This was her first three-vs-three captains encounter as well as her record-shattering 6th contest against her sister, Valerie.
► Valerie Winston is 3-5-3. This was her first three-vs-three captains encounter as well as her record-shattering 6th contest against her sister, Lauren.
Because of their participation, STAR WARS was recognized as the first event to feature
ECDElite
Hall of Famers both as allies and enemies
post-induction
.
RECEPTION
STAR WARS received acclaimed reviews from various critics.
Kevin Fitzpatrick awarded the event 10 out of 10, stating that "it was definitely the best event so far this year, hands down.
Everyone
played awesome." He also praised the fairness of the teams as a reason for the event's success. Opposing team general Michael Edwards also rated the event a perfect 10. "All of the dodgeball veterans produced some incredible competition; it was almost inevitable the two sides would end in a tie."
Top selection Zach Katz rated the event 8 out of 10, citing that "balanced teams, fast-paced action, quick games, and some format changes to mix things up" were all key ingredients. "Aside from multiple headshots .. this event was non-stop fun." Diana DiBuccio agreed with Katz's ranking, explaining "that an event like this shows that people are still able to step up and play hard." She also applauded the efforts of the captains.
Kelly Oberto, who granted the event an impressive 9/10, stated "the
only
downside is the bruises left over from massive hits to my leg and ass."
Despite spending a majority of STAR WARS in the crowd, Joanice Lima gave a flawless 5 out of 5 stars. "The teams were really even. I loved the idea of the elimination(s) of the captains."
EXTERNAL LINKS
►
East Coast Dodgeball
Facebook page
► Previous 3-vs-3 matches ..
DODGEBALL 100
,
DODGEBALL CXV
,
DODGEBALL 150
,
DIVORCE COURT
► Major August events ..
DODGEBALL 50
, DODGEBALL 100, DODGEBALL 150,
DODGEBALL 151
,
IMMACULATE REDEMPTION
________________________________________
______________________
body_html:
"For two thousand, one hundred, sixty nine agonizing days,
the East Coast Dodgeball empire has been in a state of civil war."


STAR WARS was the 184th East Coast Dodgeball event produced within the "Tronolone Era." It took place on August 13, 2011, emanating from the Wall High School tennis courts located in Wall, New Jersey. It was recorded as the 36th Wet War.

STAR WARS featured one main attraction that involved members of the 2011 East Coast Dodgeball roster from existing rivalries partly initiated by embellished storylines. Dodgeball players portrayed as themselves in an intensified manner as they followed a series of outings that built tension and culminated in a duel, commonly known as a "captains match."

Twenty (20) people participated, an attendance comprised of 12 men and 8 women.

  • PRODUCTION
    The Wall High School tennis courts have played host to ECD events since late-2005, a legacy that continued for the STAR WARS presentation. The event itself gained media attention through Facebook as well as ECD's website and exclusive TextMessagingService.

    No official theme song was selected for the event, although the introduction anthem to the STAR WARS movies composed by John Williams was played during the opening rush. Diana DiBuccio compiled the musical playlist for the event.

  • STARRING
    Adams, Christopher : Premiere legend, de facto chancellor during the 2009 ECD era.
    Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 3; Inducted into ECDElite Hall of Fame September 11, 2010.
    Edwards, Michael : Iconic crazy man, sole survivor of the dreaded 2006 summer.
    Debuted at DODGEBALL 47; Inducted into ECDElite Hall of Fame November 27, 2010.
    Fitzpatrick, Kevin : Feared powerhouse, The Writer's top combatant of the modern age.
    Debuted at DODGEBALL XTWO; Inducted into ECDElite Hall of Fame September 11, 2010.
    Pierce, Justin : Respected court general, multi-time award recipient.
    Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 2; Inducted into ECDElite Hall of Fame September 11, 2010.
    Winston, Lauren : Famed framer of East Coast Dodgeball.
    Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 1; Inducted into ECDElite Family wing of the Hall of Fame, November 27, 2010.
    Winston, Valerie : Famed framer of East Coast Dodgeball.
    Debuted at DODGEBALL DAY 1; Inducted into ECDElite Family wing of the Hall of Fame, November 27, 2010.

  • SUPPORTING CAST
    Adams, Kevin^ : 2010 ECDElite inductee.
    Adams, Steve* : 2x season finale headliner.
    Buckley, Grace^ : Rookie sensation of 2011.
    DiBuccio, Diana^ : 2010 ECDElite inductee.
    Hoppe, Ashley* : CREAMation X headliner.
    Katz, Zach* : Future ANNIVERSARY 6 headliner.
    Knott, Rob* : 2011 ECD photographer.
    Lima, Joanice^ : Rookie sensation of 2011.
    Oberto, Kelly^ : Rookie sensation of 2011.
    Stopa, Lauren* : 2011 ECDElite inductee.
    Teitelbaum, Jason* : FAMILY AFFAIR II headliner.
    Tronolone, John^ : 2011 ECDElite inductee.
    Wolf, Justin^ : Future ANNIVERSARY 6 headliner.
    Writer, The : Behind-the-scenes mastermind of ECD.
    Yochum, Jon* : FAMILY AFFAIR II headliner.
    * = designates member of Team Adams, L. Winston, Edwards
    ^ = designates member of Team Pierce, V. Winston, Fitzpatrick

    Bertsch, Alison : Spectator.
    Grand, Katie : Spectator.
    Moss, Samuel : Spectator.
    Winston, Roethlisberger : Spectator (dog).

  • BACKGROUND
    (See the STAR WARS Preview)

  • MAIN EVENT
    Justin Pierce, Valerie Winston, Kevin Fitzpatrick fought Chris Adams, Lauren Winston, Michael Edwards to a 5 - 5 draw.

    ► Stipulation: Games 3, 6, and 8 were competed under the "Captains Kill" / "Kill the Captain" rule. If the chosen captain was eliminated in any fashion, his or her entire team lost that round regardless of the number of in-play participants. The Writer paired the opposing captains prior to the match: Fitzpatrick-Edwards, Pierce-Adams, Winston-Winston.

    Game 3 witnessed Michael Edwards single-handedly eliminate rival Kevin Fitzpatrick from competition. Edwards was on the verge of a multi-player attack before wisely rifling a weapon of his own to capture the monumental game victory.

    In Game 6, Chris Adams was the sole survivor for his team before carefully regenerating a fraction of his squad to his aid. The extra time allowed him to carefully connect with a bulletball shot to rival Justin Pierce's foot, who had remained in a defense state throughout the round.

    The Winston sisters were heavily guarded during the 8th game as massive amounts of amo were unleashed upon the set of siblings. The round came to a close when Valerie Winston unintentionally dodged into a Michael Edwards-thrown bulletball. With this victory, the Adams-L. Winston-Edwards coalition captured all three of these special contests.

    It should be noted that the stipulation was originally set for every third game, but due to time restraints, round 9 was moved up one.

    ► Game-By-Game: Pierce-V. Winston-Fitzpatrick took home rounds 1, 5, 7, 9, and 10; Adams-L. Winston-Edwards won games 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8. The deciding 11th game was in progress when the tennis lights powered off. Thus, the score remained at a deadlocked 5 apiece.

  • INJURIES
    A total of 8 headshots were reported during STAR WARS. In the opening contest, Justin Wolf was met with a speeding bulletball from Chris Adams directly to the left eye. Ashley Hoppe received three stinging shots herself, one of which shed a trivial amount of blood to her nose. Steve Adams, Jason Teitelbaum, and captains Edwards and Pierce were also perpetrated in similar fashion.

    In an update from the previous month's SUMMER JAMBOREE, John Tronolone announced that his glenoid labrum, a fibrocartilaginous rim attached around the shoulder blade, is partially torn. An MRI and visit to an orthopedic surgeon confirmed such in late-July. Under doctors' orders, he was recommended to cease full-force throwing with his right arm.

  • AFTERMATH
    Because of the shocking, inconclusive decision, The Writer has already announced that a rematch, particularly between the Winston sisters, will take place "in the near future." As of August 16, 2011, no word has been given on if and when the male co-captains will meet again.

    The heated Katz-Wolf confrontation continued throughout STAR WARS and will culminate in a captains duel at ANNIVERSARY 6 on September 10, 2011.

  • STATISTICS
    The special stipulation was the first to be officially used at an ECD event. Previous outings had included such, but were never instituted upon the actual captains.

    As of August 16, 2011, captaincy statistics are as follows:
    ► Chris Adams is 7-7-1. This was his second three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL CXV in December 2007.
    ► Michael Edwards is 5-2-2. Along with Fitzpatrick, this was his record-sharing third three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL 100 and DIVORCE COURT.
    ► Kevin Fitzpatrick is 7-3-1. Along with Edwards, this was his record-sharing third three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL 100 and DODGEBALL CXV.
    ► Justin Pierce is 3-1-1. This was his second three-on-three captains encounter following DODGEBALL 100 in August 2007, and his first match in the captains chair since that very same event.
    ► Lauren Winston is 4-5-3. This was her first three-vs-three captains encounter as well as her record-shattering 6th contest against her sister, Valerie.
    ► Valerie Winston is 3-5-3. This was her first three-vs-three captains encounter as well as her record-shattering 6th contest against her sister, Lauren.

    Because of their participation, STAR WARS was recognized as the first event to feature ECDElite Hall of Famers both as allies and enemies post-induction.

  • RECEPTION
    STAR WARS received acclaimed reviews from various critics.

    Kevin Fitzpatrick awarded the event 10 out of 10, stating that "it was definitely the best event so far this year, hands down. Everyone played awesome." He also praised the fairness of the teams as a reason for the event's success. Opposing team general Michael Edwards also rated the event a perfect 10. "All of the dodgeball veterans produced some incredible competition; it was almost inevitable the two sides would end in a tie."

    Top selection Zach Katz rated the event 8 out of 10, citing that "balanced teams, fast-paced action, quick games, and some format changes to mix things up" were all key ingredients. "Aside from multiple headshots .. this event was non-stop fun." Diana DiBuccio agreed with Katz's ranking, explaining "that an event like this shows that people are still able to step up and play hard." She also applauded the efforts of the captains.

    Kelly Oberto, who granted the event an impressive 9/10, stated "the only downside is the bruises left over from massive hits to my leg and ass."

    Despite spending a majority of STAR WARS in the crowd, Joanice Lima gave a flawless 5 out of 5 stars. "The teams were really even. I loved the idea of the elimination(s) of the captains."
